layer-0-inverse.$description: Use for high contrast page or component backgrounds.

layer-1.$description: Use for high contrast page or component backgrounds.

layer-2.$description: Use for high contrast page or component backgrounds.

fill.$description: The background color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-hover.$description: The hover state color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-active.$description: The hover state color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-press.$description: The active state (on press) color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-disabled.$description: The disabled state color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-inverse.$description: The background color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-inverse-hover.$description: The background color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-inverse-active.$description: The background color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-inverse-press.$description: The background color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-inverse-disabled.$description: The disabled state color of contained elements with a smaller surface area, like a button.

fill-accent.$description: The background color of elements with a smaller surface area on an inverse background.

fill-accent-hover.$description: The background color of elements with a smaller surface area on an inverse background.

fill-accent-active.$description: The background color of elements with a smaller surface area on an inverse background.

fill-accent-press.$description: The background color of elements with a smaller surface area on an inverse background.

fill-accent-subtle.$description: The background color of elements with a smaller surface area on an inverse background.

fill-negative.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

fill-negative-subtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

fill-negative-hover.$description: The hover state color for communicating critical information on elements with a smaller surface area.

fill-negative-press.$description: The selected state color for communicating critical information on elements with a smaller surface area.

fill-warning.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating warning on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

fill-warning-subtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating warning on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

fill-positive.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating success on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

fill-positive-subtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating success on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

fill-info.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating important information on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or button.

fill-info-subtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating important information on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or button.

fill-alpha-subtle.$description: The background color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha-subtle-hover.$description: The hover state color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha-subtle-press.$description: The selected state color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha-inverse-subtle.$description: The background color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha-inverse-subtle-hover.$description: The hover state color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha-inverse-subtle-press.$description: The selected state color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha.$description: The background color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

fill-alpha-inverse.$description: The background color of elements that need to sit on different background colors, like tabs.

secondary.$description: Use for text with a secondary level of prominence.

placeholder.$description: Use for text with a secondary level of prominence.

disabled.$description: Use for text with a secondary level of prominence.

disabled-inverse.$description: Use for text with a secondary level of prominence.

accent.$description: Use for text communicating important information.

accent-on-bg-fill.$description: Use for text communicating important information.

negative.$description: Use for text communicating critical information.

negative-on-bg-fill.$description: Use for text communicating critical information.

negative-on-bg-fill-subtle.$description: Use for text communicating critical information.

info.$description: Use for text communicating important information.

info-on-bg-fill.$description: Use for text communicating important information.

info-on-bg-fill-subtle.$description: Use for text communicating important information.

link.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating success on elements with a smaller surface area, like a badge or a banner.

link-hover.$description: The hover state color for communicating success on elements with a smaller surface area.

link-press.$description: The active state (on press) color for communicating success on elements with a smaller surface area.

primary.$description: The default color for borders on any element.

primary-hover.$description: The hover color for borders on any element.

primary-active.$description: The hover color for borders on any element.

primary-focus.$description: The hover color for borders on any element.

primary-disabled.$description: The disabled color for borders on any element.

secondary.$description: The default color for borders on any element.

negative.$description: Use for borders communicating critical information.

primary-disabled.$description: The disabled state color for icons.

primary-inverse.$description: Use for icons on an inverse background.

primary-inverse-hover.$description: The hover state color for icons.

primary-inverse-active.$description: The hover state color for icons.

primary-inverse-disabled.$description: The disabled state color for icons.

secondary.$description: The disabled state color for icons.

negative.$description: Use for icons on an inverse background.
